content.description: This route is located just to the left of a small bush near the upper third of the cliff. It is between The Flirt and Smitten. Either walk up the diagonal ramp or make a large awkward, yet strangely fun mantel to clip the first bolt. From there, climb up somewhat slopey holds to the chains.
content.location: #2 on map, left to right ramp below first bolt

content.description:
Very easy short lead, follows a slant that might as well be stairs.  Super easy holds for clipping.  It's  a good lead to learn the basics and get used to the leading psych-out factor.

We've also set up a top-rope off the chains and climbed the section just right of the actual route.  That's a little harder, but watch out for loose rocks (it's not cleaned up at all).
content.protection: 4-5 draws to chains.  Chains are set up a little weird.
content.location: On Date Wall, it's farthest to the left, on the very edge of the parking area.  Look for the shiny new bolts.

content.description: This route features easy climbing past the first three bolts, but to get to the fourth, you'll have to utilize a nasty sloper.  Its crux is what makes this route so fun.
content.location: #3 on topo, look for the big ledge 2/3 of the way up.

content.description: This is the easiest and shortest bolted climb in the canyon. Due to the fact that the clips are close together and are made off of good holds, this climb makes for a good first lead. It is also a good option for the kids and those who may be afraid of heights. There is also a variation to this climb by avoiding the large corner holds and using only the face holds. Doing so bumps the rating up to maybe a 5.8
content.location: Climbs the slanting dihedral on the right side of the wall (#5 on topo)

content.description: The start of this climb requires you to use small balancy crimpers before surmounting two small roofs.  The crux lies between the two when good features seem to run out. The crux is definately a brainteaser and requires some problem solving.  the last fifteen feet are a little runout, but extremely easy.
content.location: #4 on topo, look for a white patch of rock next to the first bolt that resembles a fish (hence the name)

content.description: This easy climb features ledges, sidepulls and mantles. The clips are all made from good holds and ledges. The bottom moves (between first and second bolts) take the most problem solving
